title.narrative: Peterson Institute for International Economics Partnership 2020-2022

description.narrative: The objective of the project is provide policy-analysis to expand decarbonization in developing countries to address the global threat of climate change and support sustainable and inclusive development. The project is intended through its expert analysis of climate change related issues affecting developing countries to offer a set of practical policy solutions to the problems identified in the key project theme areas. Policy ideas spurned by this project in each of its proposed policy research papers will be formulated in an accessible format, aiming to inform and shape the public debate in both developed and developing countries. Key target audiences for this project include developing government officials and legislators, business and labor leaders, management and staff at international organizations, university-based scholars and their students, experts at other research institutions and nongovernmental organizations, the media, and the public at large.
